column4: Hey, i just installed ubuntu.. really easy, and very good looking. I havnt used linux very much. but I cant find my windows drives.. Can I access them in some easy way? they are fat32
they're fat32?
you misspelt multiverse (no l)
that page tells you if you scroll down a bit, or... maybe, yeah, click "editing sources form the command line" at the top.
you using se.archive.ubuntu.com for anything else?
well, you're editing that file, right?  do you see any other se.archive urls?
yeah alot of them
alright, you might pastebinning your sources.list?
sure
sorry, I don't see any problems.  I thought it might've been that the mirror was having problems, but it doesn't look it.  You'll have to hope someone else knows why.
no, wget can grab it
sources.list (or software sources, for a GUI)
no
deb-src if you're planning on grabbing source from stuff.  backports are actually a little dangerous to have in your sources.list
Did you verify the CD? (check for defects)  Is this the alternate CD or desktop CD?
Verify it, to make sure the CD doesn't have errors
There's an option on the boot menu.  Or should be
Alternate CD is a textmode installer instead of the liveCD/installer
command > file
thx
That overwrites, to append use >>
